subject: Personal Finance
title: Asset Allocation Basics
description: A short lesson to help you apply Asset Allocation Basics.

hook.text: Your mix of stocks, bonds, and cash matters more than which specific stocks you pick.

buildup.text: Asset allocation is dividing your portfolio among different investment categories.

discovery.text: Studies show asset allocation explains over 90% of portfolio return variation â€” not stock picking.

twist.text: More stocks means more growth potential but more volatility. More bonds means stability but lower returns.

climax.text: A common rule: subtract your age from 110 to get your stock percentage. At 30, hold 80% stocks.

punchline.text: The mix matters more than the picks.

quiz.question: What determines most of a portfolio's return variation?
